Description.45:
Sunny, comfortable bungalow with a large garden and patio area. A great space to relax and have a bbq after a day of sightseeing. The apartment is ideally located next to a supermarket and is only 5 minutes from the centre of town.

The bungalow is in a secured apartment building with free parking in the vicinity. There is one large bedroom and a large sofa bed for extra guests. Personally, my favorite aspect of our home is the garden and with the great weather in Bordeaux we use it almost all year round.

The apartment has abundant closet space, as well as a large shower, many windows (you will have sunshine all day long), and a fully furnished kitchen with a fridge, hot plate, toaster, oven, blender, coffee machine and lots of counter space.

There is a direct bus from the Bordeaux train station which drops you off 2 minutes away from the house. There is also a VCUB (city bicycle) station in front of the home, which makes it even easier to get around.

We are readily available if you need information about the city or help with anything.

There is a carrefour market located next to the apartment. Nearby are also pharmacies, bakeries, restaurants, and bars. The home is in a quiet residential area located 5 minutes away from Gambetta, a hot spot for nightlife and restaurants.

There is also a weekly farmers' market just a 10 minute walk away.

We hope that guests will enjoy our adopted city as much as we do!

We are both flamenco musicians who love to travel. We hope that you enjoy our adopted city and home as much as we do.

Description.289:
Hi 

I offer you a chance to find accommodation and attend the biggest 1/4 finale of the Euro 2016, Germany-Italy, on Saturday, July 2, at 9pm.

WARNING: I do NOT rent without selling the game ticket at the same time. On the other hand, if you don't need accommodation, let's talk about the tickets.

I have up to 4 tickets available, all next to each other, category 3.

Do NOT book directly, write me to make an offer

Thanks :)

I'll come and meet you in person

Great views

Bonjour ! Hello! �Hola! Ol�! Ciao! Hallo! ?????? ("privyet"), ????? ("konnichiwa")! ?



I am David, born French, with half my blood Portuguese, but now considered a World Citizen, since I started, mid-2008, a project called "Around the World in 80 months and 10 languages".



I arrived in Tokyo mid-October, and Japan is now the 12th country where I have been living (living for me is with a minimum of 3 months), after France (by Lille &amp, Aix-en-Provence), U.S.A. (Huntington Beach, California), Spain (Barcelona), Mexico (D.F.), Argentina (Buenos Aires), Portugal (Lisbon), Italy (Florence &amp, Rome), Austria (Vienna), Germany (Berlin), Ukraine (Kiev) &amp, Russia (Moscow &amp, St Petersburg)... in the last 5 years!



I am here on a working-holiday visa, working as a host for Airbnb, and as well from time to time as a (mainly background) actor.



After 3 weeks searching, I finally found a wonderful location to live in... but couldn't decide between a studio-flat and an apartment with 2 bedrooms, 4 floors above... I decided to take both, and share my luck with people here, with YOU! ?



This is my first time hosting through Airbnb, but I've had some 130+ guests (in 11 countries) through the most famous hospitality exchange website (which I cannot mention here not to be censored :p), so know how to take care of my guests... but as well respect privacy... basically, to adapt ,-)



As well I've stayed with almost 250 locals, in dozens of countries (traveled to 40+ countries), and hitchhiked dozens of thousands of kilometers, so that helps me understanding the needs of a tourist/traveler.



My life and travels around the world also mean that if you want to know something about the worldS around you, I guess I can help you ,-)



And if you want somebody to help you adapting to Japanese culture, as I've recently faced cultural differences, I would be happy to share my knowledge too, and introduce you to my Japanese friends if you want.



Looking forward to making your stay in Tokyo, Japan, a memorable one. And trust me, this country is totally worth coming to!



David ?
